name: language
description: Sets the language for carpet

name: carpetCommandPermissionLevel
description: Carpet command permission level. can only be set via .conf file
validators: This setting can only be set by admins with op level 4

name: superSecretSetting
description: Gbhs sgnf sadsgras fhskdpri!!!

name: portalCreativeDelay
description: Amount of delay ticks to use a nether portal in creative
validators: You must choose a value from 1 to 72000

name: portalSurvivalDelay
description: Amount of delay ticks to use a nether portal in survival
validators: You must choose a value from 1 to 72000

name: ctrlQCraftingFix
description: Dropping entire stacks works also from on the crafting ui result slot

name: persistentParrots
description: Parrots don't get of your shoulders until you receive proper damage

name: xpNoCooldown
description: Players absorb xp instantly, without delay

name: stackableShulkerBoxes
description: Empty shulker boxes can stack when thrown on the ground.
extras: .. or when manipulated inside the inventories
validators: Value must either be true, false, or a number between 2-64

name: explosionNoBlockDamage
description: Explosions won't destroy blocks

name: xpFromExplosions
description: Experience will drop from all experience barring blocks with any explosion type

name: tntPrimerMomentumRemoved
description: Removes random tnt momentum when primed

name: optimizedTNT
description: Tnt causes less lag when exploding in the same spot and in liquids

name: tntRandomRange
description: Sets the tnt random explosion range to a fixed value
extras: Set to -1 for default behavior
validators: Cannot be negative, except for -1
optimizedTNT must be enabled

name: hardcodeTNTangle
description: Sets the horizontal random angle on tnt for debugging of tnt contraptions
extras: Set to -1 for default behavior
validators: Must be between 0 and 2pi, or -1

name: mergeTNT
description: Merges stationary primed tnt entities

name: fastRedstoneDust
description: Lag optimizations for redstone dust
extras: by Theosib
.. also fixes some locational behaviours or vanilla redstone MC-11193
so behaviour of locational vanilla contraptions is not guaranteed

name: huskSpawningInTemples
description: Only husks spawn in desert temples

name: shulkerSpawningInEndCities
description: Shulkers will respawn in end cities

name: piglinsSpawningInBastions
description: Piglins will respawn in bastion remnants
extras: Includes piglins

name: tntDoNotUpdate
description: Tnt doesn't update when placed against a power source

name: antiCheatDisabled
description: Prevents players from rubberbanding when moving too fast
extras: ... or being kicked out for 'flying'
Puts more trust in clients positioning
Increases player allowed mining distance to 32 blocks

name: quasiConnectivity
description: Pistons, droppers and dispensers react if block above them is powered

name: flippinCactus
description: Players can flip and rotate blocks when holding cactus
extras: Doesn't cause block updates when rotated/flipped
Applies to pistons
observers
droppers
repeaters
stairs
glazed terracotta etc...

name: hopperCounters
description: Hoppers pointing to wool will count items passing through them
extras: Enables /counter command
and actions while placing red and green carpets on wool blocks
Use /counter <color?> reset to reset the counter
and /counter <color?> to query
In survival
place green carpet on same color wool to query
red to reset the counters
Counters are global and shared between players
16 channels available
Items counted are destroyed
count up to one stack per tick per hopper

name: movableAmethyst
description: Allows budding amethyst blocks to be moved
extras: Allow for them to be moved by pistons
as well as adds extra drop when mining with silk touch pickaxe

name: renewableSponges
description: Guardians turn into elder guardian when struck by lightning

name: movableBlockEntities
description: Pistons can push block entities, like hoppers, chests etc.

name: chainStone
description: Chains will stick to each other on the long ends
extras: and will stick to other blocks that connect to them directly.
With stick_to_all: it will stick even if not visually connected

name: desertShrubs
description: Saplings turn into dead shrubs in hot climates and no water access

name: silverFishDropGravel
description: Silverfish drop a gravel item when breaking out of a block

name: summonNaturalLightning
description: Summoning a lightning bolt has all the side effects of natural lightning

name: commandSpawn
description: Enables /spawn command for spawn tracking

name: commandTick
description: Enables /tick command to control game clocks

name: commandProfile
description: Enables /profile command to monitor game performance
extras: subset of /tick command capabilities

name: perfPermissionLevel
description: Required permission level for /perf command

name: commandLog
description: Enables /log command to monitor events via chat and overlays

name: defaultLoggers
description: Sets these loggers in their default configurations for all new players
extras: use csv

name: commandDistance
description: Enables /distance command to measure in game distance between points
extras: Also enables brown carpet placement action if 'carpets' rule is turned on as well

name: commandInfo
description: Enables /info command for blocks
extras: Also enables gray carpet placement action
if 'carpets' rule is turned on as well

name: commandPerimeterInfo
description: Enables /perimeterinfo command
extras: ... that scans the area around the block for potential spawnable spots

name: commandDraw
description: Enables /draw commands
extras: ... allows for drawing simple shapes or
other shapes which are sorta difficult to do normally

name: commandScript
description: Enables /script command
extras: An in-game scripting API for Scarpet programming language

name: commandScriptACE
description: Enables restrictions for arbitrary code execution with scarpet
extras: Users that don't have this permission level
won't be able to load apps or /script run.
It is also the permission level apps will
have when running commands with run()
validators: When changing the rule, you must at least have the permission level you are trying to give it

name: scriptsAutoload
description: Scarpet script from world files will autoload on server/world start
extras: if /script is enabled

name: scriptsDebugging
description: Enables scripts debugging messages in system log

name: scriptsOptimization
description: Enables scripts optimization

name: scriptsAppStore
description: Location of the online repository of scarpet apps
extras: set to 'none' to disable.
Point to any github repo with scarpet apps
using <user>/<repo>/contents/<path...>

name: commandPlayer
description: Enables /player command to control/spawn players

name: allowSpawningOfflinePlayers
description: Spawn offline players in online mode if online-mode player with specified name does not exist

name: commandTrackAI
description: Allows to track mobs ai via /track command

name: carpets
description: Placing carpets may issue carpet commands for non-op players

name: missingTools
description: Glass can be broken faster with pickaxes

name: fillUpdates
description: Fill/clone/setblock and structure blocks cause block updates

name: interactionUpdates
description: Placing blocks cause block updates

name: liquidDamageDisabled
description: Disables breaking of blocks caused by flowing liquids

name: smoothClientAnimations
description: Smooth client animations with low tps settings
extras: works only in SP

name: pushLimit
description: Customizable piston push limit
validators: You must choose a value from 1 to 1024

name: railPowerLimit
description: Customizable powered rail power range
validators: You must choose a value from 1 to 1024

name: fillLimit
description: Customizable fill/clone volume limit
validators: You must choose a value from 1 to 20M

name: forceloadLimit
description: Customizable forceload chunk limit
validators: You must choose a value from 1 to 20M

name: maxEntityCollisions
description: Customizable maximal entity collision limits, 0 for no limits

name: pingPlayerListLimit
description: Customizable server list ping (multiplayer menu) playerlist sample limit

name: customMOTD
description: Sets a different motd message on client trying to connect to the server
extras: use '_' to use the startup setting from server.properties

name: rotatorBlock
description: Cactus in dispensers rotates blocks.
extras: Rotates block anti-clockwise if possible

name: viewDistance
description: Changes the view distance of the server.
extras: Set to 0 to not override the value in server settings.
validators: You must choose a value from 0 (use server settings) to 32

name: simulationDistance
description: Changes the simulation distance of the server.
extras: Set to 0 to not override the value in server settings.
validators: You must choose a value from 0 (use server settings) to 32

name: spawnChunksSize
description: Changes size of spawn chunks
extras: Defines new radius
setting it to 0 - disables spawn chunks

name: lightEngineMaxBatchSize
description: Changes maximum light tasks batch size
extras: Allows for a higher light suppression tolerance
setting it to 5 - Default limit defined by the game

name: renewableCoral
description: Coral structures will grow with bonemeal from coral plants
extras: Expanded also allows growing from coral fans for sustainable farming outside of warm oceans

name: renewableBlackstone
description: Nether basalt generator without soul sand below
extras: .. will convert into blackstone instead

name: renewableDeepslate
description: Lava and water generate deepslate and cobbled deepslate instead below y0

name: placementRotationFix
description: Fixes block placement rotation issue when player rotates quickly while placing blocks

name: leadFix
description: Fixes leads breaking/becoming invisible in unloaded chunks

name: lagFreeSpawning
description: Spawning requires much less cpu and memory

name: flatWorldStructureSpawning
description: Allows structure mobs to spawn in flat worlds

name: moreBlueSkulls
description: Increases for testing purposes number of blue skulls shot by the wither

name: fogOff
description: Removes fog from client in the nether and the end
extras: Improves visibility

name: creativeNoClip
description: Creative no clip
extras: On servers it needs to be set on both
client and server to function properly.
Has no effect when set on the server only
Can allow to phase through walls
if only set on the carpet client side
but requires some trapdoor magic to
allow the player to enter blocks

name: creativeFlySpeed
description: Creative flying speed multiplier
extras: Purely client side setting
meaning that
having it set on the decicated server has no effect
but this also means it will work on vanilla servers as well

name: creativeFlyDrag
description: Creative air drag
extras: Increased drag will slow down your flight
So need to adjust speed accordingly
With 1.0 drag
using speed of 11 seems to matching vanilla speeds.
Purely client side setting
meaning that
having it set on the decicated server has no effect
but this also means it will work on vanilla servers as well

name: cleanLogs
description: Removes obnoxious messages from the logs
extras: Doesn't display 'Maximum sound pool size 247 reached'
Which is normal with decent farms and contraptions

name: structureBlockLimit
description: Customizable structure block limit of each axis
extras: WARNING: Needs to be permanent for correct loading.
Setting 'structureBlockIgnored' to air is recommended
when saving massive structures.
Required on client of player editing the Structure Block.
'structureBlockOutlineDistance' may be required for
correct rendering of long structures.
validators: You have to choose a value greater or equal to 48

name: structureBlockIgnored
description: Changes the block ignored by the structure block

name: structureBlockOutlineDistance
description: Customizable structure block outline render distance
extras: Required on client to work properly

name: lightningKillsDropsFix
description: Lightning kills the items that drop when lightning kills an entity

name: updateSuppressionBlock
description: Placing an activator rail on top of a barrier block will fill the neighbor updater stack when the rail turns off.
extras: The integer entered is the amount of updates that should be left in the stack
-1 turns it off
validators: This value represents the amount of updates required before the logger logs them. Must be -1 or larger

name: creativePlayersLoadChunks
description: Creative players load chunks, or they don't! just like spectators!
extras: Toggling behaves exactly as if the player is in spectator mode and toggling the gamerule spectatorsGenerateChunks.

description: Customizable sculk sensor range
validators: You must choose a value from 1 to 1024

name: combineXPOrbs
description: Xp orbs combine with other into bigger orbs

description: Empty shulker boxes can stack to 64 when dropped on the ground

name: onePlayerSleeping
description: One player is required on the server to cause night to pass

name: renewableCoral
description: Coral structures will grow with bonemeal from coral plants

name: extremeBehaviours
description: Edge cases are as frequent as common cases, for testing only!!

blaze projectiles
fireworks
Directions of fireballs
wither skulls
fishing bobbers
items dropped from blocks and inventories
llamas spit
triggered trap horses
Damage dealt with projectiles
Blaze aggro sensitivity
Mobs spawned follow range

name: structureBlockOutlineDistance
description: Customizable structure block outline render distance
extras: Required on client to work properly

name: updateSuppressionBlock
description: Placing an activator rail on top of a barrier block will update suppress when the rail turns off.
extras: Entering an integer will make the update suppression block auto-reset
Integer entered is the delay in ticks for it to reset
validators: Cannot be negative, can be true, false, or # > 0

description: Fixes update suppression causing server crashes.

description: Max distance for scaffolding.

they will blink visually
but that's only to minimize changes required for it to work

name: updateSuppressionCrashFix
description: Fixes updates suppression causing server crashes.

firing that
dropper will cause it to craft (drop as item) that recipe.

Also makes hoppers
droppers and dispensers input max 1 item per slot.

extras: Behind: Allows comparators to detect item frames in the block behind them
Lenient: Allows comparators to detect any item frames within the block behind a full block
Extended: Allows comparators to detect item frames on a full block behind the comparator

name: maxChunksSavedPerAutoSave

extras: This is for the system which just attempt to save chunks every tick. Max chunks saved per tick

name: delayBetweenAutoSaves
description: Allows you to change the delay between autosaves in ticks
extras: Shortening this number will make your server save more often which will also spread the load on the server

name: maxTickLatency
description: Allows you to change max tick delay before a task is cancelled
extras: Lower value raises the task leniency. Basically lower number means higher chance of success

name: statusUpdateDelay

extras: delay is in nanoseconds. Default is 5 seconds (5000000000) [1m
5s

this is the delay between chunks aggressively saving

name: maxHostileSpawnLightLevel
description: Adjusts the maximum light level general hostile mobs can spawn in
extras: When maxHostileSpawnLightLevel < 7
block light level is used to determine whether the position
is considered \"dark\" or not
while leaving spawn chances at and below the maximum light level intact
When maxHostileSpawnLightLevel > 7
the upper bound of the random integer generator is increased
in order to accommodate for higher light levels
thereby affecting mob spawning chances at light
levels > 0 and <= 7
most likely increasing mob spawning chances over vanilla
validators: You must choose a light level from 0 to 15

zombies

ghasts
withers
ender dragons
rabbits
sheep

except_player - Give the target chunk a load ticket when all entities except the player through the ender gateway.

both - Both bots and players are allowed to gain stats.
none - No one allowed to gain stats.
player - Only players are allowed to gain stats.

extras: instant_death - Dies immediately when entering the void.
teleport_to_spawn - Teleport to the player's spawn point when entering the void
or to the world spawn point if it does not exist.
vanilla - Vanilla behaviour.

description: Falling anvils crush stony types

description: Falling anvils crush ice
extras: frosted ice -> ice -> packed ice -> blue ice

description: Falling anvils take damage

extras: this can permanently alter the behaviour of any villages traded with while this rule was activated

description: Players don't get hurt by flying into walls

description: Treat axes as weapons (e.g. allow looting in survival)

description: Zombified piglin no long spawn in nether portals

description: Keep experience points on death

description: Dispensers can place boats on ice

extras: dispenser & dropper give the same velocity to the falling block like they do in 22w13oneblockatatime

name: craftableTuff
description: Craft tuff from andesite and cobblestone
extras: Expect a lag spike when changing the value

name: missingCobbleRecipes
description: Adds missing recipes for allowing blackstone and cobbled deepslate in place of cobblestone
extras: Expect a lag spike when changing the value

name: splashOxidize
description: Copper blocks oxidize one stage when hit with a water bottle

name: sculkBlocksAlwaysDropXp
description: Sculk blocks always drop XP when destroyed
extras: Allows for fully automatic XP farms without a wither

name: snowMelting
description: Whether snow can melt

name: antiSpamDisabled
description: Disable spamming checks on players, including: chat message cooldown, creative item drop cooldown

name: blockEventPacketRange
description: Set the range where player will receive a block event packet after a block event fires successfully
extras: For piston the packet is used to render the piston movement animation. Decrease it to reduce client's lag

name: blockPlacementIgnoreEntity
description: Disable entity collision check before block placement, aka you can place blocks inside entities
extras: Works with creative mode players only

name: cauldronBlockItemInteractFix
description: Make player be able to place block against cauldron block with any filled level
extras: Affected Minecraft <= 1.16.x. This annoying behavior is already been fixed in 1.17+

name: chunkUpdatePacketThreshold
description: The threshold which the game will just send an chunk data packet if the amount of block changes is more than it
extras: Increasing this value might reduce network bandwidth usage, and boost client's fps if there are lots of tile entities in a chunk section with a lot of block changes
Set it to really high to simulate 1.16+ behavior, which is no chunk packet but only multiple block change packet
This rule is only available in <1.16

name: chunkTickSpeed
description: Modify how often the chunk tick occurs per chunk per game tick
extras: The default value is 1. Set it to 0 to disables chunk ticks
Affected game phases: thunder, ice and snow, randomtick
With a value of n, in every chunk every game tick, climate things will tick n times, and randomtick will tick n * randomTickSpeed times per chunk section

name: clientSettingsLostOnRespawnFix
description: Fixed stored client settings are not migrated from the old player entity during player respawn or entering end portal in the end
extras: So mods relies on client settings are always able to work correctly, e.g. serverside translation of this mod and worldedit mod

name: commandLifeTime
description: Enables /lifetime command to track entity lifetime and so on
extras: Useful for mob farm debugging etc.

name: commandManipulate
description: Enables /manipulate command for world related manipulation command

name: commandRaid
description: Enables /raid command for raid listing and tracking

name: commandRefresh
description: Enables /refresh command for synchronizing your client to the server

name: commandRemoveEntity
description: Enables /removeentity command for directly erase target entities from the world

name: creativeOpenContainerForcibly
description: Allow creative players to open a container even if the container is blocked. e.g. for shulker box

name: dispenserNoItemCost
description: Dispensers and droppers execute without having the itemstack inside decreased
extras: Either dropping and using items do not cost, but dropper transferring item still costs

name: dispensersFireDragonBreath
description: Dispenser can fire dragon breath bottle to create a dragon breath effect cloud

name: enchantCommandNoRestriction
description: Remove all enchantment restriction checks inside /enchant command

name: entityMomentumLoss
description: Set it to false to disable entity axis momentum cancellation if it's above 10m/gt when being loaded from disk

name: entityPlacementIgnoreCollision
description: Disable block and entity collision check during entity placement with items
extras: Affected items: armorstand, end crystal, all kinds of boat
Spawn egg items are not affected

name: entityTrackerDistance
description: The maximum horizontal chebyshev distance (in chunks) for the server to sync entities information to the client
extras: Basically this works as a "entity view distance", but will still be limited to the server view distance
Set it to a value not less than the server view distance to make the server sync all entities within the view distance to the client
Set it to a non-positive value to use vanilla logic
Requires chunk reloading to set the new rule value to entities

name: entityTrackerInterval
description: The time interval (in gametick) for the server to sync entities information to the client
extras: With a small number e.g. 1, entity information will be synced to the client every 1 gametick, resulting in less-likely client-side entity desync
Set it to a non-positive value to use vanilla logic
Requires chunk reloading to set the new rule value to entities

name: explosionPacketRange
description: Set the range where player will receive an explosion packet when an explosion happens

name: failSoftBlockStateParsing
description: Ignore invalid property keys/values in block state arguments used in e.g. /setblock command
extras: In vanilla invalid property keys/values cause command failure when parsing, this rule suppresses that
Useful during cross-version litematica schematic pasting etc.

name: fakePlayerNamePrefix
description: Add a name prefix for fake players spawned with /player command
extras: Set it to #none to stop adding a prefix
Which can prevent summoning fake player with illegal names and make player list look nicer

name: fakePlayerNameSuffix
description: Add a name suffix for fake players spawned with /player command
extras: Set it to #none to stop adding a suffix

name: farmlandTrampledDisabled
description: Disable farmland being able to be trampled into dirt by mobs

name: fluidDestructionDisabled
description: Disable block destruction by fluid flowing
extras: Fluid will just simple stopped at the state before destroying the block
It's useful to prevent liquid from accidentally flooding your redstone wiring in creative

name: hopperCountersUnlimitedSpeed
description: Make hopper pointing towards wool has infinity speed to suck in or transfer items with no cooldown
extras: Only works when hopperCounters option in Carpet Mod is on

name: hopperNoItemCost
description: Hopper with wool block on top outputs item infinitely without having its item decreased
extras: You can use /scounter command or subscribe to the scounter logger to track the amount of the output items
This rule is also the switch of the /scounter command

name: HUDLoggerUpdateInterval
description: Overwrite HUD loggers update interval (gametick)

name: instantCommandBlock
description: Make command blocks on redstone ores execute command instantly instead of scheduling a 1gt delay TileTick event for execution
extras: Only affects normal command blocks

name: itemEntitySkipMovementDisabled
description: Removed the movement skipping mechanism when ticking of item entity
extras: Brings back <=1.13 item entity behavior, where item entities with low velocity on ground still tick movement every gt instead of every 4gt
Useful when you require precise item entity movement timing
Breaks related redstone devices, e.g. 2no2name's wireless redstone

name: keepMobInLazyChunks
description: The mobs in lazy chunks will not despawn
extras: This option only have effects between Minecraft 1.15 and 1.16

name: largeBarrel
description: The best storage block ever: Large barrel
extras: Two adjacent barrel blocks with their bottom side facing towards each other create a large barrel
The behavior and logic of large barrel is just like large chest

name: lifeTimeTrackerConsidersMobcap
description: Strategy for lifetime tracker to deal with mob that doesn't count towards mobcap
extras: true: Don't track mobs that don't count towards mobcap, and treat mobs as removal as soon as they don't affect mobcap e.g. right when they pick up some items. Good for mob farm designing
false: Tracks everything it can track and mark mobs as removal when they actually get removed. Good for raid testing Good for raid testing or non-mobfarms

name: lightEngineMaxBatchSize
description: Changes maximum light tasks batch size
extras: Allows for a higher light suppression tolerance
Setting it to 5 - Default limit defined by the game

name: lightQueueLoggerSamplingDuration
description: The sampling duration of light queue logger in game tick
extras: Affects all data except the queue size displayed in the logger

name: lightUpdates
description: Pause or disable light updates
extras: If set to suppressed, no light update can be executed which simulates light suppressor
If set to ignored, no light update can be scheduled. It's useful for creating light errors
If set to off, no light update can be scheduled or executed
[WARNING] If set to suppressed or off, new chunks cannot be loaded. Then if the server tries to load chunk for player movement or whatever reason the server will be stuck forever

name: microTiming
description: Enable the function of MicroTick logger
extras: Display redstone components actions, block updates and stacktrace with a wool block
Use /log microTiming to start logging
Might impact the server performance when it's on
EndRods will detect block updates and redstone components will show their actions
- Observer, Piston, EndRod: pointing towards wool
- Repeater, Comparator, Rail, Button, etc.: placed on wool
Beside that, a universal block actions logging method is using EndRod on wool block to point on the block you want to log
Check rule microTimingTarget to see how to switch logging method

name: microTimingDyeMarker
description: Allow player to right click with dye item to mark a block to be logged by microTiming logger
extras: You need to subscribe to microTiming logger for marking or displaying blocks
Right click with the same dye to switch the marker to end rod mode with which block update information will be logged additionally. Right click again to remove the marker
Right click a marker with slime ball item to make it movable. It will move to the corresponding new position when the attaching block is moved by a piston
Use `/carpet microTimingDyeMarker clear` to remove all markers
You can create a named marker by using a renamed dye item. Marker name will be shown in logging message as well
You can see boxes at marked blocks with fabric-carpet installed on your client. With carpet-tis-addition installed the marker name could also be seen through blocks

name: microTimingTarget
description: Modify the way to specify events to be logged in microTiming logger. Events labelled with dye marker are always logged
extras: labelled: Logs events labelled with wool
in_range: Logs events within 32m of any player
all: Logs every event. Use with caution
marker_only: Logs event labelled with dye marker only. Use it with rule microTimingDyeMarker

name: microTimingTickDivision
description: Determine the way to divide game ticks
extras: world_timer: Divides at Overworld timer increment
player_action: Divides at the beginning of player action

name: minecartTakePassengerMinVelocity
description: Determine the minimum required horizontal velocity for a minecart to pick up nearby entity as its passenger
extras: Set it to 0 to let minecart always take passenger no matter how fast it is, just like a boat
Set it to NaN to let minecart never takes passenger

name: mobcapsDisplayIgnoreMisc
description: Ignore mob type "misc" in carpet mobcaps displays
extras: Since it's useless: Nothing in misc category spawns, and it's ignored when calculating mobcap
Affects mobcaps logger and /spawn mobcap command

name: observerNoDetection
description: Stop observer from scheduling tile tick event after it receives a state update
extras: Basically this rule disables the detection functionality of observers

name: opPlayerNoCheat
description: Disable some command to prevent accidentally cheating
extras: Affects command list: /gamemode, /tp, /teleport, /give, /setblock, /summon

name: optimizedFastEntityMovement
description: Optimize fast entity movement by only checking block collisions on current moving axis
extras: Inspired by the fastMovingEntityOptimization rule in carpetmod112
Use with rule optimizedTNT to greatly improve performance in cannons

name: optimizedHardHitBoxEntityCollision
description: Optimize entity colliding with entities with hard hit box
extras: It uses an extra separate list to store entities, that have a hard hit box including boat and shulker, in a chunk
It reduces quite a lot of unnecessary iterating when an entity is moving and trying to search entities with hard hit box on the way,since the world is always not filled with boats and shulkers
Enable it before loading the chunk to make it work. ~20% performance boost in portal mob farms
Might not work with other mods that add new entities

name: optimizedTNTHighPriority
description: Use a Mixin injection with higher priority for carpet rule optimizedTNT
extras: So the rule optimizedTNT can overwrite lithium's explosion optimization
Of course rule optimizedTNT needs to be on for it to work

name: poiUpdates
description: Whether block changes will cause POI to updates or not
extras: Set it to false to disable POI updates

name: persistentLoggerSubscription
description: Remember the subscribed loggers as well as logging options of the player during server restart
extras: Only applies carpet's defaultLoggers rule at someone's first login
Logger subscriptions are saved in config/carpettisaddition/logger_subscriptions.json

name: preciseEntityPlacement
description: When placing / summoning entity with item, place the entity at the exact position of player's cursor target position
extras: Affected items: Spawn eggs, armorstand, ender crystal

name: railDupingFix
description: Disable rail duping using old school pushing lit powered or activator rail method

name: redstoneDustRandomUpdateOrder
description: Randomize the order for redstone dust to emit block updates
extras: It's useful to test if your contraption is locational or not
Does not work with rule fastRedstoneDust

name: renewableDragonEgg
description: Make dragon egg renewable
extras: When a dragon egg is in dragon breath effect cloud it has a possibility to absorb the effect cloud and "summon" a new dragon egg
Use with rule "dispensersFireDragonBreath" for more ease

name: renewableDragonHead
description: Ender dragon killed by charged creeper will drop dragon head

name: renewableElytra
description: Phantom killed by shulker will drops an elytra with given possibility
extras: Set it to 0 to disable

name: repeaterHalfDelay
description: Halve the delay of redstone repeaters upon a redstone ore
extras: The delay will change from 2, 4, 6 or 8 game tick instead of 1, 2, 3 or 4 game tick

name: sandDupingFix
description: Disable sand and other gravity block duping using end portal
extras: Gravity block includes sand, anvil, dragon egg and so on
In sand dupers sand will only get teleported to the other dimension

name: snowMeltMinLightLevel
description: The minimum light level allowed for snow to melt
extras: In vanilla the value is 12, which means snow will melt when the light level >=12 when random ticked
Set it to 0 to melt all annoying snow on your builds
Set it to the same level as the minimum light level for snow to not fall on block (light level 10) to easily test if your build is snow-proof with light or not
You can modify gamerule randomTickSpeed to speed up the melting progress, or modify carpet rule chunkTickSpeed to speed up the snowfall progress

name: structureBlockDoNotPreserveFluid
description: Structure block do not preserve existed fluid when placing waterlogged-able blocks
extras: Has a side effect of suppressing bug MC-130584 happening

name: structureBlockLimit
description: Overwrite the size limit of structure block
extras: Relative position might display wrongly on client side if it's larger than 32

name: structureBlockOutlineDistance
description: Customizable Structure Block outline render distance
extras: Required on client to work properly

name: synchronizedLightThread
description: Synchronize lighting thread with the server thread
extras: so the light thread will not lag behind the main thread and get desynchronized
The server will wait until all lighting tasks to be done at the beginning of each world ticking
With this rule you can safely /tick warp without potential light suppression or lighting desynchronization

name: tileTickLimit
description: Modify the limit of executed tile tick events per game tick

name: tntDupingFix
description: Disable TNT, carpet and part of rail dupers
extras: Attachment block update based dupers will do nothing and redstone component update based dupers can no longer keep their duped block
Dupe bad dig good

name: tntFuseDuration
description: Overwrite the default fuse duration of TNT
extras: This might also affect the fuse duration of TNT ignited in explosion

name: tntIgnoreRedstoneSignal
description: Prevent TNT blocks from being ignited from redstone
extras: You can still use explosion etc. to ignite a tnt

name: tooledTNT
description: Tools on the player's main hand is applied to item dropping during the explosion caused by the player
extras: So you can ignite TNT to harvest blocks that require specific tool or enchantment as long as you are holding the right tool
For example, you can harvest ice with silk touch pickaxe, or harvest grass with shears
It also works for any other living entities beside player
Technically this rule applies the main hand item of the causing entity onto the loot table builder during the explosion

name: totallyNoBlockUpdate
description: Disable all block updates and state updates

name: turtleEggTrampledDisabled
description: Disable turtle egg trampled to broken

name: ultraSecretSetting
description: qOf DSh hwg ORRWHW Cb

name: visualizeProjectileLoggerEnabled
description: Enable visualize projectile logger
extras: Try /log projectiles visualize

name: voidRelatedAltitude
description: Modify the related altitude between the bottom of the world and the void where entities will receive void damages

name: witherSpawnedSoundDisabled
description: Disable the wither spawned sound emitted when a wither fully reset its health after summoned

name: xpTrackingDistance
description: Overwrite the tracking distance of xp orb
extras: Change it to 0 to disable tracking
